نبيهه خطيب
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Short stories, Arabic--Palestine

Manners and customs--Religious aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: Brothers; Castles; Envy; Family relations; Fathers; Fāṭimah, -632 or 633; God's will; Guests; Inheritance; Invocation; Journeys; Landowners; Letters; Living conditions; Magic; Maliciousness; Marital Abandonment; Marriage; Money; Orphans; Passing on memories; Pilgrims; Princes; Queens; Religious belief; Routes; Ruqyah (Islam); Sisters; Uncles; Winter; Birds; Bread; Complaints; Food; Jewelry; Loggers; Magic; Maliciousness; Neighborhoods; Peasants; Stoves; Stupidity; al-Shāṭir Muḥammad; Armed patrols; Arrest; Beheading; Birds; Boats; Cities and towns; Food; Horses; Islands; Journeys; Kingdoms; Kings; Loss; Magic; Magic objects; Marriage; Mourning; Ogres; Orchards; Polygamy; Queens; Rulers; Sons; Work
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded on September 20, 1997 with Nabīhah Khatīb, female, born in 1927 in ʻAmqā, Palestine.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع نبيهه خطيب في 20 أيلول سبتمبر عام 1997، أنثى، ولدت عام 1927 في عقا، فلسطين.
